roleset.name: construct
roleset.note: BUILD-V NOTES: Frames file for 'build' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus (from build.01-v predicate notes)
BUILDING-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry build.01, OntoNotes grouping building-n sense 3; maps to VN class build-26.1-1. Framed by Claire. (from building.01-n)

roles.note: No Arg 3 for consistency with other "build" type verbs. (from build.01-n)No Arg 3 for consistency with other "build" type verbs. (from building.01-n)

example.name: build-v: basic
example.text: Stephen Wozniak and Steven Jobs built the Apple I in a garage.

example.name: build-v: theoretically possible start state
example.text: John built his house of straw.

example.name: do_build-l: light verb
example.text: We will either be moving home or doing a self build if nothing suitable comes on the market.
example.arg: if nothing suitable comes on the market

example.name: building-n: Arg1 only
example.text: The building of the skyscraper took three months.

example.name: building-n: Args 0 & 1
example.text: Surprisingly, little mention of the outstanding role played by the military in their building of the Great North Road is made in official

example.name: building-n: Args 1 & 4
example.text: The building of sailing craft into a national art form is a notable accomplishment of Kuwaitis.

example.name: building-n: Args 1, 2
example.text: Masonry is the building of structures from individual units laid in and bound together by mortar.
example.arg: from individual units laid in and bound together by mortar

roleset.name: grow
roleset.note: BUILD-V NOTES: Frames file for 'build' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus (from build.02-v predicate notes)

role.descr: amount increased by, EXT or MNR

example.name: build-v: with substrate
example.text: But it's building on a long tradition.

example.name: build-v: with end state - into
example.text: They built Quebecor into an integrated paper, publishing, and printing concern.
example.arg: into an integrated paper, publishing, and printing concern.

example.name: build-v: with end state - to
example.text: GM built its cash reserves to $5.5 billion.

roleset.name: include
roleset.note: BUILD-V NOTES: This will probably only occur with "build into", but I don't want tomake a phrasal verb out of it. (from build.03-v)

role.descr: theme, thing being included in some group

example.name: build-v: passivized
example.text: Higher volatility gets built into the stock market.

roleset.name: build up: cause to be bigger
roleset.note: BUILD_UP-V NOTES: Basically the same as 'construct' roleset id="build.04" of 'build' (from build.05-v predicate notes)
BUILD_UP-N NOTES: Based on Thyme data. Comparison to build.05. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from build.02-n)
BUILDUP_UP-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from buildup.02-n)

role.descr: end point, end state of arg1

example.name: build_up-v: mmmm, pulp
example.text: He built up the pulp and paper segment of the company.
example.arg: the pulp and paper segment of the company

example.name: build_up-v: unaccusative
example.text: Plaintiffs' lawyers say that buildings become ``sick'' when inadequate fresh air and poor ventilation systems lead pollutants to build up inside.

example.name: build_up-v: with end point
example.text: Even Peter Lynch, manager of Fidelity's $12.7 billion Magellan Fund, the nation's largest stock fund, built up cash to 7% or $850 million.
example.arg: Peter Lynch, manager of Fidelity's $12.7 billion Magellan Fund, the nation's largest stock fund

example.name: build_up-n: With material
example.text: A fraction may survive and the build-up of such mistakes may eventually lead to cancer.
